summary: This document is a chain of emails from December 2019 regarding travel approval requests for a team investigating the Epstein case (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). The emails detail planned trips to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach for victim interviews and meetings, with requests for flights, hotels, and conference rooms. It reveals ongoing investigative activity months after Epstein's death.

connections.description: Both are part of the same investigation team traveling for interviews related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Planned Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: Travel planned for the investigation team to Los Angeles for an interview (or possibly interviews) on December 16 and/or 17, with flights and hotel booked.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Travel was requested for an interview in Los Angeles on November 14, 2019, as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel was requested for an interview in West Palm Beach on November 4, 2019, with a request for a conference room.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Travel was requested for a victim interview in Los Angeles, with plans for a conference room at a hotel.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel was requested for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Travel Approval for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Travel was requested and approved for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach for the case United States v. Epstein, described as an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Initial travel request for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document references an active investigation titled 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618' described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity,' indicating ongoing federal proceedings after Epstein's death.
Travel was being coordinated as late as December 2019 for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach, showing the investigation continued for months after Epstein's arrest and death.
The emails show a pattern of travel for witness/victim interviews, with requests for conference rooms at hotels to conduct these interviews.
Multiple individuals are referenced by initials (S, M) but their full identities are redacted, suggesting they are federal prosecutors or investigators involved in the case.
The travel requests specify the need for refundable tickets due to potential changes in witness availability, indicating the sensitive and fluid nature of the investigation.
